tourBios.curYrHigh: Played in 10 Web.com Tour events, making seven cuts. Finished 98th on the money list...Best finish was a T3 at the Digital Ally Open in August, when he posted rounds of 64-70-65-65, six behind winner Martin Piller's pace. Top-25 finish (T16) came at the Nova Scotia Open in July. Recorded his first Tour hole-in-one at the Regular Season-ending WinCo Foods Portland Open and added another eagle at the par-5 11th in the same second round...Missed the cut in his one Mackenzie Tour-PGA TOUR Canada start in June.

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 11-45 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (exempt to second reshuffle)
tourBios.curYearHigh: Played in 10 Web.com Tour events, making seven cuts. Finished 98th on the money list...Best finish was a T3 at the Digital Ally Open in August, when he posted rounds of 64-70-65-65, six behind winner Martin Piller's pace. Top-25 finish (T16) came at the Nova Scotia Open in July. Recorded his first Tour hole-in-one at the Regular Season-ending WinCo Foods Portland Open and added another eagle at the par-5 11th in the same second round...Missed the cut in his one Mackenzie Tour-PGA TOUR Canada start in June.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Finished T100 in Web.com Tour Q-School in December...Played eight Asian Tour tournaments. Made four cuts, with his best results back-to-back T12 and T16 finishes in September.

 2013: His seven starts were highlighted by a T2 at the Dakota Dunes Open in July. Finished the season 31st on Order of Merit...First PGA TOUR appearance came at the U.S. Open (missed cut)...Played in early-season Web.com Tour events in Chile and Brazil, missing both cuts...Lone Latinoamérica event came at Mundo Maya Open in May. Finished T33.

 2012: Made 17 appearances in his first full Web.com Tour season but only made four cuts...Best outing was a T40 at the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open...Late in the season, ventured to South Korea and finished T9 at the CJ Invitational, carding a 64 in the opening round...Earned conditional status for the 2013 Web.com Tour after finishing T118 at the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament. 

2011: Qualified for the Utah Championship but missed the cut. 2010: Missed the cut at the Stadion Classic at UGA...Four events in PGA TOUR Canada resulted in three cuts made, including a seventh and a T10.

2010: In six appearances, had a third and a T4. Was 30th on final Order of Merit. 

2009: Made 12 Mackenzie Tour - PGA TOUR Canada starts, including five top-10s and eight top-25s. Birdied the third playoff hole to win the Roxul Jane Rogers Championship in August. Finished the year seventh on the Order of Merit. 

2007: Was T30 at the 2007 Livermore Valley Wine Country Championship in his first start.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Advanced to the semifinals of both the 2006 U.S. Amateur and Canadian Amateur...Won the 2002 Alberta Amateur...Had three tournament wins during his college career at Kent State. Named Mid-American Conference Player of the Year in 2005 and Freshman of the Year in 2003. Named to the All-MAC team for four years.
tourBios.personal: Is a self-taught player and has never had a coach...Says playing in the 2006 U.S. Amateur is the highlight of his golf career...Never travels without his iPad...Uses a Kent State ball marker...Favorite teams are Kent State and the Cleveland Cavaliers...Has one sister...Attended Bishop Carroll High School in Calgary...Would like to switch places for a day with the President of the United States...Not many people know he has a Michael Jordan shoe collection...Would put Jordan, his dad and Tiger Woods in his dream foursome...Supports the Ronald McDonald House...Lists Carnoustie as his favorite course and Cabo San Lucas in Mexico as his favorite vacation spot.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T30th in 2007 at the Livermore Valley Wine Country Championship at Wente Vineyards.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T27th in Current Par or Better Streak on the Web.com Tour.
